title: World's 10 craziest roller coasters [Photos]
text:
Friday, July 31, 2015 08:00 AM EDT World’s 10 craziest roller coasters Previous Next 
For many thrill-seekers out there, summer is a time to hit the amusement park for a day of stomach-churning rides. If you think you’ve got nerves of steel, have a look at our top 10 picks of the world’s scariest roller coasters. 
1. Leviathan, Canada’s Wonderland, Toronto Billed as Canada’s tallest and fastest roller coaster, this 3-minute thrill-ride features a 306-foot plunge at an angle of 80 degrees while reaching speeds of 148 km/h. (Photo courtesy Canada's Wonderland.)Watch it in action here: Photo courtesy Canada's Wonderland 
2. Formula Rossa, Ferrari World, Abu Dhabi What’s even more exciting than driving a Formula One car, riding on the world’s fastest roller coaster that’s built above a Formula One racetrack. Designed to resemble the Ferrari Formula One car, the Formula Rossa cars accelerate to 240km/h in under 5 seconds and a G-force of 4.8Gs. (Handout)Watch it in action here: COURTOISIE 
3. Kingda Ka, Six Flags Great Adventure, New Jersey North America’s tallest and fastest steel roller coaster is the King. This upside down U-shaped ride bolts up 456 feet and spirals down 416 feet at 90 degrees with a top speed of 206 km/h. (Six Flags Great Adventure Facebook photo)Watch it in action here: 
4. Takabisha, Fuji-Q Highland, Japan How do you make the world’s steepest roller coaster? Build one with a hump that’s perpendicular to the ground. The Takabisha features a 121 degree drop and has seven stomach-flipping twists. (Fujikyu Highland/Handout)Watch it in action here: 
5. Goliath, Six Flags Great America, Illinois The world’s steepest, fastest and longest wooden roller coaster boasts a 180-foot drop at 85 degrees, while travelling at speeds of up to 116 km/h. (Six Flags/PR News Foto)Watch it in action here: 
6. GateKeeper, Cedar Point, Ohio Billed as an acrobatic experience, the GateKeeper’s 170-foot dive drop is bound to deliver an adrenaline rush. (Cedar Point Facebook photo) Watch it in action here: 
7. Steel Dragon 2000, Nagashima Spa Land, Japan As the world’s longest roller coaster, the Steel Dragon is an endurance test for your nerves – even if it’s just for four minutes. This ride takes you through 2,479 metres of twists and turns with one jittery minute spent anticipating a 306-foot drop. (File photo)Watch it in action here: AP 
8. Bizarro, Six Flags New England, Massachusetts: If there’s such a thing as a roller coaster with a view, the Bizarro might just be the one. The mamoth ride features a 219-foot drop into a tunnel brimming with fog, while offering some of the most picturesque views of the Connecticut River. (Courtesy Six Flags Entertainment Corporation)Watch it in action here: 
9. Full Throttle, Six Flags Magic Mountain, California Aptly name, this ride launches to a speed of 110 km/h and passes through a record-breaking 160-foot-tall vertical loop in under one minute. (Six Flags Magic Mountain Facebook photo)Watch it in action here: 
10. Batman: The Ride, Six Flags Fiesta Texas, San Antonio: Brace yourself to take on Batman: The Ride! This new coaster at Six Flags Fiesta Texas features a 4D spinning wing that sends riders 37 metres in the air, before flipping riders six times, followed by two vertical free falls. (Courtesy IAAPA International Association of Amusement Parks and Attractions)Watch it in action here: Article
